name: Sticky Garlic Pork Chops
author: Chef John
summary: This sticky garlic pork chop recipe seems too good to be true. It only takes a few minutes of prep work, requires no tricky techniques, and doesn't call for any hard-to-find ingredients. I served this with some bok choy brown rice.
ingredients: 6 cloves garlic, crushed, or more to taste
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
2 teaspoons hot sauce, or to taste
directions: Combine brown sugar, garlic, rice vinegar, and fish sauce in a bowl for the marinade
Add a splash of soy sauce and a plop of ketchup
Finish off with black pepper and hot sauce
Pour 1/2 of the marinade into a baking dish and lay pork chops over marinade
Pour the remaining marinade on top and toss pork chops until well coated
Wrap with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator, flipping chops every 30 minutes, 1 to 2 hours
Remove chops to a plate, scraping any excess marinade back into the baking dish
Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat
Place chops in the hot oil
Cook until outsides are nicely charred and meat springs back when lightly prodded, about 5 minutes per side
Remove chops to a plate to rest
Pour the marinade into the skillet
Cook until marinade is reduced and sticky, 3 to 5 minutes
Return pork chops and any accumulated juices to the skillet
Cook pork chops, flipping and basting occasionally, until the centers are slightly pink and sauce is to your desired degree of stickiness, 6 to 8 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the pork should read about 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
Plate each pork chop and spoon a portion of the sticky garlic sauce on top
